required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of a High-Protein Liquid Dietary Supplementation
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of a High-Protein Liquid Dietary Supplementation in Improving Nutritional Status of Malnourished Patients in Hospital Care: a Preliminary Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study was a double-blind randomized controlled trial conducted to assess the effectiveness of high protein liquid dietary supplementation in malnourished hospitalized patients. The patients were assessed for their nutritional status based on ESPEN 2015 criteria. Patients who experienced malnutrition will be divided into 2 groups, namely the control group which was given a normal protein liquid diet, while the intervention group was given high protein liquid diet supplementation as much as 2 bottles (200 mL) per day for 7-10 days. Furthermore, the nutritional status of the patient was assessed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Handgrip strength is assessed at day 10 of dietary administration supplementation in each arm
primary_outcome.description: Handgrip strength in kg based on sex and age

primary_outcome.measure: Adult malnutrition classification according to the WHO
primary_outcome.time_frame: the classification of malnutrition is assessed at day 10 of dietary supplementation in each arm
primary_outcome.description: The classification of Adult malnutrition according to the WHO based on BMI which categorized into (mild,moderate or severe)

primary_outcome.measure: Nutritional status based on Subjective Global Assessment (SGA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: All SGA assesment is done at day 10 of dietary supplementation in each arm
primary_outcome.description: the Nutritional status based on Subjective Global Assessment (SGA). Group A is classified as Normal/ well-nourished. Group B is classified as Mild-Moderate nutrition. Group C is classified as Severe malnutrition.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Randomly selected malnourished patients for normal protein liquid diet supplementation
arm_group.description: Randomly selected malnourished patients for normal protein liquid diet supplementation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Randomly selected Malnourished patients with high protein liquid diet supplementation
arm_group.description: Malnourished patients with high protein liquid diet supplementation

intervention.intervention_name: a hospital formula of normal protein liquid diet supplementation
intervention.description: group 1 (control group) who will get a hospital formula of normal protein liquid diet supplementation (40 grams per 1000 mL)
intervention.arm_group_label: Randomly selected malnourished patients for normal protein liquid diet supplementation

intervention.intervention_name: a hospital formula of high protein liquid food supplementation
intervention.description: group 2 (intervention group) will get a hospital formula of high protein liquid food supplementation (60 grams per 1000 mL) as much as 2 bottles (each bottle contains 200 mL)
intervention.arm_group_label: Randomly selected Malnourished patients with high protein liquid diet supplementation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects aged ≥ 18 years old to 60 years old
2. Malnutrition hospitalized patient based on European Society for Clinical Nutrition and Metabolism (ESPEN) 2015 criteria
3. Agreed to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Malignancy
2. Chronic kidney disease stage III-V
3. Decompensated hepatic cirrhosis
4. Allergic to milk or lactose intolerance
5. Could not be randomised and participate in this study by clinical judgement
